name: 'The Dogs Of War' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: To whom did Leo make this quote, "Have you been drinking his kool-aid"?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Josh entered Leo's office ranting about what the new Speaker of the House was going to do now that he was in office and what they had to do to stop him. When Leo was finally able to get Josh to stop ranting, he asked Toby if he had been drinking Josh's kool-aid.

questions.text: What happened to Josh's new intern, Ryan Pierce, when he was following Josh and Donna to the cafeteria?
options: He got lost and they were still looking for him at episode end
questions.explanation:
He fell.

	Ryan followed Josh and Donna down to the cafeteria to find Toby and show him a quote made by Steve Atwood. He was keeping up with Josh and Donna's quick pace until he fell. He quickly got up and continued following them. Ironically, he fell right after asking them why they walk so fast.

questions.text: While in the residence talking with Leo, Jed quoted a famous person right before telling Leo that he had become part of the darkness. Who did the President quote?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

	President Bartlet quoted Doctor King, "The ultimate weakness of violence is that it is a descending spiral. Returning violence with violence only multiplies violence, add deeper darkness to a night already devoid of stars." Then he asked Leo when he became part of that darkness.

questions.text: When Donna told Josh he had one-hundred thirty two phone messages, what did he say half of them were?
options: Wanting to know how he could let Walken inside the White House
His mother wanting to know if he had been eating
questions.explanation:
Changing long distance carriers.

	Josh was asleep in his office with a 'Do Not Disturb' sign posted on his door when Amy called him. She brought him bagels and real coffee. While they were in his office, Amy and Josh learned of the US bombings of Qumar. When Josh left his office, Donna told him about his phone messages.

questions.text: When Leo met Angela in the parking lot, how long had it been since Zoey was kidnapped?
questions.explanation:
One day.

	When Leo met Angela in a parking garage, the screen had Zoey's kidnapping at hour twenty-four making one full day since she was kidnapped. Leo was meeting with Angela to see how the people were responding to the President leaving office temporarily and letting Walken have power.

questions.text: Did Walken tell Debbie he never wanted to be President of the United States?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Debbie came into the Oval Office to inform President Walken that he had two more calls to make to grieving families. She mentioned that she was a fan of President Truman and President Walken told her that he never wanted to be President of the United States. Debbie told him that Truman didn't either.

questions.text: Josh told his new intern Ryan Pierce that which member of his graduation class graduated summe cum laude?
questions.explanation:
His girlfriend.

	Ryan saw Josh's Harvard diploma and the fact that he graduated cum laude. Josh told him that the only member of his class to graduate summe cum laude was his girlfriend. When Ryan asked Josh where he graduated college, Ryan told him that he went to Harvard.

questions.text: After Zoey was found, which speech did the President use when addressing the nation?
options: Neither. He spoke from the heart
questions.explanation:
Will's speech.

	The President used the speech Will wrote on the off chance that Zoey didn't make it home alive. Toby had written the speech for the time when Zoey was returned home. The President used Will's speech which included, "the Lord giveth and the Lord taketh away".

questions.text: What hospital was Zoey taken to after she was found?
questions.explanation:
Walter Reed.

	President Bartlet told Leo that Abbey and the others were with Zoey at Walter Reed hospital where Zoey had been taken after she was found. Everyone except Abbey watched the speech given by the President in the Rose garden. Abbey stared out a window while the TV showed the speech over her shoulder.

questions.text: From where does the title of this "The West Wing" episode come?
questions.explanation:
Shakespeare.

	In the fifth season premiere, Jed Bartlet made the Shakespearean quote, "Cry havoc! And let slip the dogs of war". The second episode of the fifth season was titled "The Dogs Of War".
